conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, analyze their velocity-time graphs and find the time at which their positions coincide.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the particle.
For particle A, the graph is a triangle with a peak at 2v0 at time t0.
For particle B, the graph is a trapezoid with a constant velocity v0 from 0 to 3t0, and then a triangle with a peak at v0 at time 5t0.
The area under the graph for A is a triangle with base 3t0 and height 2v0, so displacement of A is 3t0v0.
The area under the graph for B is a trapezoid and a triangle, so displacement of B is 5t0v0.
A and B meet when their displacements are equal, but 3t0v0 = 5t0v0 is incorrect.
Graph for B has a constant velocity v0 from 0 to 3t0, and then a triangle from 3t0 to 5t0.
Area under the graph for B from 0 to 3t0 is a rectangle, so sB = 3t0v0.
Area under the graph for B from 3t0 to 5t0 is a triangle, so sB = t0v0.
Set sA = sB, but 3t0v0 = 4t0v0 is incorrect.
A and B do not meet at any time within the given time frame.
